title: Exchange visa (subclass 411)
summary: This page provides information for existing holders and sponsors of the Exchange visa (subclass 411), which closed to new applications on 24 November 2012. It outlines visa conditions, obligations, sponsorship rules, and procedures for changing sponsors or circumstances. The page also includes detailed sponsor obligations and compliance requirements under the Migration Act 1958.

structured_data.applicability: Information applies only to people already holding an Exchange visa (subclass 411) and their sponsors.

visa_validity.general_validity: Valid for the period of the nominated position

what_visa_lets_you_do: Come to Australia temporarily to broaden work experience and skills
Stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position (max 2 years)
Bring family members (they can work and study)
Leave and re-enter Australia unlimited times while the visa is valid
visa_holder_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Maintain adequate health insurance while in Australia

prohibited_actions: Stop working for the sponsoring employer
Engage in work or activities inconsistent with the nominated position
Work for another person or for yourself while working for your sponsor

required_actions: Be sponsored by another organisation to stay in Australia
Leave Australia before the visa expires

general_rules: No new visa required unless visa is close to expiry
Nomination by the new sponsor must be approved before commencing work
if_visa_close_to_expiry: Be sponsored by the new organisation
New organisation must lodge a nomination under subclass 401 Temporary Work (Long Stay Activity)
New organisation may need to apply for approval as a long stay activity sponsor if not already approved
if_visa_not_close_to_expiry: Be sponsored by the new organisation
New organisation must lodge Form 1378 Nomination for a Temporary Position

entry_conditions: Family cannot enter Australia before the visa holder
departure_requirements: Family must leave Australia when the visa ends with the visa holder
ongoing_obligations: Remain members of the visa holderâ€™s family unit
rights: Family can work or study while their visa is valid

events_requiring_notification: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport

sponsor_information.can_sponsor_new_applicants: No, sponsorship for subclass 411 is closed

sponsorship_validity.during_validity: Can sponsor participants for subclass 401 Temporary Work (Long Stay Activity)
sponsorship_validity.after_expiry: Must apply to be approved as a long stay activity sponsor to continue sponsorship

conditions: Allowed if the visa is still valid
Sponsor must lodge Form 1378 Nomination for a Temporary Position

sponsor_obligations.general_responsibility: Sponsors remain responsible even if using an authorised representative
obligations_list: Notify the department when specific events occur
Provide records and information when requested
Not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Provide equivalent opportunities to Australian exchange participants
Ensure the visa holder participates only in the nominated occupation, program, or activity

inspector_purpose: Determine if illegal workers have been employed
Identify other circumstances warranting administrative action

obligation_period.starts: From sponsorship approval or work agreement commencement
obligation_period.ends: Five years after sponsorship ends or work agreement ceases

cooperation_examples: Not preventing access to records or documents
Providing access for officers to interview persons on premises

required_records: Date, method, and location of notifications made to the department

obligation_period.ends: Two years after sponsor is no longer approved and no longer sponsoring anyone

record_keeping.maximum_retention: Records need not be kept for more than five years

when_required: To determine compliance with sponsorship obligations
To determine if circumstances for administrative action exist
requirements: Must provide requested records or information in manner and timeframe specified
Must comply if records are required under Commonwealth, state or territory law, or under sponsor obligations

obligation_period.starts: When sponsorship is approved or work agreement commences
obligation_period.ends: Two years after sponsorship/work agreement ceases AND sponsor no longer has sponsored visa holders

notify_events.time_requirement: Within required timeframes after event occurs
